messages.content:
You are a professional academic reference prediction expert. Your task is to predict the most likely references for a given academic paper based on its title, abstract, and retrieved relevant papers.

RETRIEVER INTERFACE:
- Input: paper title + abstract
- Output: {top_r} retrieved papers with title and abstract
- Format: List of dictionaries with 'title' and 'abstract' fields

REQUIREMENTS:
1. Analyze the paper's title and abstract to understand its research area and focus
2. Consider the retrieved papers as potential references (when available)
3. Generate a list of predicted reference titles that would be most relevant and likely to be cited
4. Provide reasoning for each prediction to prevent hallucination
5. Output format: JSON object with "titles" array and "reasoning" string
6. Generate exactly 58 most relevant reference titles (this should be at least 40 to cover all evaluation metrics)
7. Ensure titles are realistic and appropriate for the research area
8. Consider citation patterns in the field
9. CRITICAL: Each title must be unique - never repeat the same title multiple times

EXAMPLE:
Input:
Title: "Question Type Classification Methods Comparison"
Abstract: "The paper presents a comparative study of state-of-the-art approaches for question classification task: Logistic Regression, Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN), Long Short-Term Memory Network (LSTM) and Quasi-Recurrent Neural Networks (QRNN). All models use pre-trained GLoVe word embeddings and trained on human-labeled data. The best accuracy is achieved using CNN model with five convolutional layers and various kernel sizes stacked in parallel, followed by one fully connected layer. The model reached 90.7% accuracy on TREC 10 test set."

Retrieved papers ({top_r}):
1. Title: Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification
   Abstract: We report on a series of experiments with convolutional neural networks trained on top of pre-trained word vectors for sentence-level classification tasks.

2. Title: Glove: Global vectors for word representation
   Abstract: We present a new global log-bilinear regression model that combines the advantages of the two major model families in the literature.

Output:
{
  "titles": [
    "Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification",
    "Glove: Global vectors for word representation",
    "Quasi-Recurrent Neural Networks",
    "A Comparative Study of Neural Network Models for Sentence Classification",
    "Deep lstm based feature mapping for query classification"
  ],
  "reasoning": "Based on the paper's focus on question classification using neural networks, I predict these references because: 1) CNN paper is directly relevant to the convolutional approach used; 2) GloVe embeddings are mentioned as pre-trained features; 3) QRNN is one of the compared methods; 4) Comparative study papers are common in this field; 5) LSTM-based query classification is closely related to question classification. Additional references cover related neural network architectures, NLP applications, deep learning methodologies, optimization techniques, and advanced neural network methods that would be relevant for this research area."
}

Return JSON object only.

Paper Title: Unsupervised Deep Probabilistic Approach for Partial Point Cloud Registration

Paper Abstract: Abstract Deep point cloud registration methods face challenges to partial overlaps and rely on labeled data. To address these issues, we propose UDPReg, an unsupervised deep probabilistic registration framework for point clouds with partial overlaps. Specifically, we first adopt a network to learn posterior probability distributions of Gaussian mixture models (GMMs) from point clouds. To handle partial point cloud registration, we apply the Sinkhorn algorithm to predict the distribution-level correspondences under the constraint of the mixing weights of GMMs. To enable unsupervised learning, we design three distribution consistency-based losses: self-consistency, cross-consistency, and local contrastive. The self-consistency loss is formulated by encouraging GMMs in Euclidean and feature spaces to share identical posterior distributions. The cross-consistency loss derives from the fact that the points of two partially overlapping point clouds belonging to the same clusters share the cluster centroids. The cross-consistency loss allows the network to flexibly learn a transformation-invariant posterior distribution of two aligned point clouds. The local contrastive loss facilitates the network to extract discriminative local features. Our UDPReg achieves competitive performance on the 3DMatch/3DLoMatch and ModelNet/ModelLoNet benchmarks.

{retrieved_text}

Generate exactly 58 most likely reference titles for this paper. Focus on papers that are directly related to the research topic, provide foundational background, present similar methodologies, or address related problems.

CRITICAL: Each title must appear exactly once. Do not repeat any title.

IMPORTANT: You must respond with ONLY valid JSON in this exact format:
{
    "titles": [
        "Reference Title 1",
        "Reference Title 2",
        "Reference Title 3",
        "Reference Title 4",
        "Reference Title 58"
    ],
    "reasoning": "Explain why you chose these specific references based on the paper's title, abstract, and retrieved papers. This helps prevent hallucination and ensures relevance."
}

Do not include any text before or after the JSON. Do not include authors, venues, or years - only the paper titles. The reasoning field is required to explain your prediction logic.

{
    "titles": [
        "Spinnet: Learning a general surface descriptor for 3d point cloud registration",
        "Pointnetlk: Robust & efficient point cloud registration using pointnet",
        "D3feat: Joint learning of dense detection and description of 3d local features",
        "Pointdsc: Robust point cloud registration using deep spatial consistency",
        "A method for registration of 3-d shapes",
        "Large-scale 3d point cloud processing for mixed and augmented reality",
        "An adaptive data representation for robust point-set registration and merging",
        "Robust reconstruction of indoor scenes",
        "Deep global registration",
        "Fully convolutional geometric features",
        "Sinkhorn distances: Lightspeed computation of optimal transport",
        "Ppf-foldnet: Unsupervised learning of rotation invariant 3d local descriptors",
        "Hgmr: Hierarchical gaussian mixtures for adaptive 3d registration",
        "Unsupervisedr&r: Unsupervised point cloud registration via differentiable rendering",
        "Joint alignment of multiple point sets with batch and incremental expectation-maximization",
        "Random sample consensus: a paradigm for model fitting with applications to image analysis and automated cartography",
        "Robust point cloud registration framework based on deep graph matching",
        "Filterreg: Robust and efficient probabilistic point-set registration using gaussian filter and twist parameterization",
        "Predator: Registration of 3d point clouds with low overlap",
        "Unsupervised point cloud registration by learning unified gaussian mixture models",
        "Feature-metric registration: A fast semi-supervised approach for robust point cloud registration without correspondences",
        "Robust point set registration using gaussian mixture models",
        "Sampling network guided cross-entropy method for unsupervised point cloud registration",
        "Density adaptive point set registration",
        "Iterative distance-aware similarity matrix convolution with mutual-supervised point elimination for efficient point cloud registration",
        "Hybridcr: Weakly-supervised 3d point cloud semantic segmentation via hybrid contrastive regularization",
        "A noninvasive method to reduce radiotherapy positioning error caused by respiration for patients with abdominal or pelvic cancers",
        "Gaussian mixture model-based registration network for point clouds with partial overlap",
        "Evaluation of 3d registration reliability and speed-a comparison of icp and ndt",
        "Point cloud registration with self-supervised feature learning and beam search",
        "Overlap-guided coarse-to-fine correspondence prediction for point cloud registration",
        "Partial point cloud registration via soft segmentation",
        "Overlap-guided gaussian mixture models for point cloud registration",
        "Point set registration: Coherent point drift",
        "Real-time point cloud alignment for vehicle localization in a high resolution 3d map",
        "3dregnet: A deep neural network for 3d point registration",
        "Computational optimal transport: With applications to data science",
        "Geometric transformer for fast and robust point cloud registration",
        "Reliable inlier evaluation for unsupervised point cloud registration",
        "Point set registration through minimization of the l 2 distance between 3d-ndt models",
        "Kpconv: Flexible and deformable convolution for point clouds",
        "Attention is all you need",
        "A robust registration method for autonomous driving pose estimation in urban dynamic environment using lidar",
        "Deep closest point: Learning representations for point cloud registration",
        "Prnet: Self-supervised learning for partial-to-partial registration",
        "3d shapenets: A deep representation for volumetric shapes",
        "Pointcontrast: Unsupervised pre-training for 3d point cloud understanding",
        "Omnet: Learning overlapping mask for partial-to-partial point cloud registration",
        "Self-supervised geometric perception",
        "Rpm-net: Robust point matching using learned features",
        "Regtr: End-to-end point cloud correspondences with transformers",
        "Cofinet: Reliable coarse-to-fine correspondences for robust pointcloud registration",
        "Deepgmr: Learning latent gaussian mixture models for registration",
        "3dmatch: Learning local geometric descriptors from rgb-d reconstructions",
        "Patchformer: An efficient point transformer with patch attention",
        "Deep learning based point cloud registration: an overview",
        "Fast global registration",
        "Loop closure detection using local 3D deep descriptors"
    ],
    "reasoning": "Selected these 58 references because they represent foundational work and recent advances in Unsupervised Deep Probabilistic Approach for Partial Point Cloud Registration, providing essential background knowledge and methodological foundations relevant to this research."
}
